A&Q Hydro Power Project – Consultant Tender
Rev.no.: 00
Rev. date: 23.09.2025
Appendix 4 – Programme
Pursuant to §4.3 Programme, the Consultant shall submit a Programme for the execution of the
Agreement, based on key dates provided by the Client.
The Client's plans for the construction of the Aasiaat & Qasigiannguit hydroelectric powerplant can be
brieﬂy described as follows:
 A tender process for the consultant’s services is started in September 2025
 Selection of a consultant group is concluded early December 2025
 Preliminary tasks of the Consultant are to update production potential by end of March 2026, deliver

revised concept design by end of May 2026, and revise the overall cost estimate by mid-June 2026.
 Tender documents shall be delivered for bidding purposes by early August 2026, following a possible
outside review by independent consultants.
 Tender process will run from August 2026 through April 2027 with Consultant responding to
technical questions from bidders, as applicable.
 EPC Contract execution is expected in May 2027.
 If the Client does not exercise its option for construction services during EPC Contract execution,

the Consultant’s Services shall terminate no later than three (3) months after execution of the EPC
Contract, provided that the Consultant shall complete all tasks necessary to ﬁnalise the EPC tender
process and contract award and shall effect a proper handover to the Client (or any third party
designated by the Client) of the Employer’s Requirements, Tender Documentation, evaluation
records, and all other relevant information.
 If Client does exercise his right to the options for construction services during EPC contract
execution, the Consultants services will continue and terminate once the construction is ﬁnished
and the post-construction inspections have been carried out.
1
Key Dates for the programme
4 December 2025 –
Start of Consultancy Agreement

31 March 2026 –
Consultant shall deliver report on updated production potential
31 May 2026 –
Delivery of revised concept design
15 June 2026 –
Revised cost estimate for the A&Q HPP
1 August 2026 –
EPC Tender Documentation delivered
1 May 2027 –

EPC evaluation report and recommendation
31 October 2031 –
Conclusion of Consultancy Agreement, assuming Options are included
2 Programme Submission
Within 14 days of the Commencement Date, the Consultant shall prepare and submit to the Client for
approval a detailed Time Programme setting out all key tasks, deliverables, milestones, dependencies,
and durations. The Programme shall include, but not be limited to:
a. Start date and projected completion date;
b. Intermediate milestones / deliverables (e.g. concept design, approvals, report submissions);

c. Dates when the Consultant requires input, approval, or information from the Client, third
parties or authorities;
d. After receiving the proposals from the Consultant that require Client’s approvals, the Client
will comment on these within 20 working days.
e. The Consultant must allocate 30 working days for any regulatory approvals by authorities.
f. Principal resources planned for each phase.
g. Float / risk allowances to mitigate likely delays.
3
Programme Acceptance and Updates

The Client shall respond to the submitted Programme within 14 days, either accepting it or proposing
amendments. Once accepted, this Programme shall govern performance. The Consultant shall provide
revised / updated Programme(s) at periodic intervals (e.g. monthly), or after any event which materially
affects the approved Programme.
4
Format of the Programme
The programme shall be delivered digitally by the Consultant in a Microsoft Project format (*.pptx). A
PDF version shall also be provided.
